Just a NIT: As an effort to maybe make this tests more 'readable' (and also less lines of codes!) I'm wondering if maybe it isn't a good idea to instead of keep repeating the 

```
Spec: corev1.PodSpec [....]
```

we couldn't create a helper function here, like createPodSpecResource(memreq, memlim, cpureq, cpulim).This would return the correct spec, and could be called on every part of the code that uses this. We can reduce 11 lines per corev1.Pod spec here (I've counted 242 lines), and would add...maybe 30 lines on the helper function? :)
Any reason not to add `t.Helper()` here too?
I just thought because that function doesnn't have `t.Errorf()` so it might not be needed ðŸ˜•  will add that in

[What `t.Helper()` does ](https://golang.org/pkg/testing/#B.Helper) is let Go know that this is a test helper, so that it can skip it when printing line and file information, which makes error reporting easier to understand when a test fails. A pretty minor thing, but since the Testing instance already has to be passed in, might as well get this benefit. ðŸ™‚
